data.chText: 剩余的部分 / 人 / 事物
data.enText: remaining part/people/things

data.chText: 剩余部分；残留；其余
data.enText: the remaining part of sth

data.chText: 我不会一辈子干这种工作。
data.enText: I'm not doing this job for the rest of my life.

data.chText: 后半天你打算怎么过？
data.enText: How would you like to spend the rest of the day?

data.chText: 把你想要的拿走，其余的丢掉。
data.enText: Take what you want and throw the rest away.

data.chText: 其余的人；其他事物；其他
data.enText: the remaining people or things; the others

data.chText: 不要责怪亚历克斯。他和我们大家一样，也是人。
data.enText: Don't blame Alex. He's human, like the rest of us.

data.chText: 第一个问题很难，但其余的都相当简单。
data.enText: The first question was difficult, but the rest were pretty easy.

data.chText: 休息时间
data.enText: period of relaxing

data.chText: 休息时间；睡眠时间
data.enText: a period of relaxing, sleeping or doing nothing after a period of activity

data.chText: 我睡了一宿好觉。
data.enText: I had a good night's rest.

data.chText: 我们停下来休息，也该休息一下了。
data.enText: We stopped for a well-earned rest.

data.chText: 放下繁重的工作，休息一下
data.enText: to have/take a rest from all your hard work

data.chText: 休息一下吧——你明天还要忙一天呢。
data.enText: Try to get some rest ─you have a busy day tomorrow.

data.chText: 明天是休息日，没有比赛，但星期一继续比赛。
data.enText: There are no matches tomorrow, which is a rest day , but the tournament resumes on Monday.

data.chText: 支撑物
data.enText: support

data.chText: 支撑物；支架；基座；托
data.enText: an object that is used to support or hold sth

data.chText: 扶手
data.enText: an armrest (= for example on a seat or chair)

data.chText: 音乐
data.enText: in music

data.chText: 休止；休止符
data.enText: a period of silence between notes; a sign that shows a rest between notes
and (all) the rest (of it)

data.chText: （列举时用）诸如此类，等等
data.enText: used at the end of a list to mean everything else that you might expect to be on the list

data.chText: 他想要大房子、豪华汽车，如此等等。
data.enText: He wants a big house and an expensive car and all the rest of it.
and the rest

data.chText: （比所说的）还要多；远不止此数
data.enText: used to say that the actual amount or number of sth is much higher than sb has stated

data.chText: “这要花250英镑…”“不止这些，不止这些！”
data.enText: ‘It cost 250 pounds…’ ‘And the rest, and the rest!’
at rest

data.chText: 静止；不动
data.enText: not moving

data.chText: 这种昆虫不动时看上去像一片枯叶。
data.enText: At rest the insect looks like a dead leaf.

data.chText: （委婉说法，与dead同义）安息，长眠
data.enText: dead and therefore free from trouble or anxiety. People say at rest to avoid saying dead .

data.chText: 她现在长眠在教堂墓地里。
data.enText: She now lies at rest in the churchyard.
come to rest

data.chText: 停止移动；不再移动
data.enText: to stop moving

data.chText: 汽车闯过护栏，在一块田里停了下来。
data.enText: The car crashed through the barrier and came to rest in a field.

data.chText: 他的目光停留在克拉拉的脸上。
data.enText: His eyes came to rest on Clara's face.
for the rest

data.chText: 除此之外；至于其他
data.enText: apart from that; as far as other matters are concerned

data.chText: 这本书中关于作者童年的一些章节倒还有意思。除此之外，便无聊至极。
data.enText: The book has some interesting passages about the author's childhood. For the rest, it is extremely dull.
give it a rest

data.chText: 不要再提（恼人的事）了
data.enText: used to tell sb to stop talking about sth because they are annoying you
give sth a rest

data.chText: 暂停；暂时不做
data.enText: to stop doing sth for a while
lay sb to rest

data.chText: （委婉说法，与bury同义）安葬
data.enText: to bury sb. People say to lay sb to rest to avoid saying to bury sb.

data.chText: 乔治被安葬在他父母墓旁。
data.enText: George was laid to rest beside his parents.
lay/put sth to rest

data.chText: （通过揭穿假象）平息，使停止
data.enText: to stop sth by showing it is not true

data.chText: 通告最终消除了一切有关他们的未来的推测。
data.enText: The announcement finally laid all the speculation about their future to rest.
the rest is history

data.chText: 结局是尽人皆知的；结果如何不必赘述
data.enText: used when you are telling a story to say that you do not need to tell the end of it, because everyone knows it already
put/set sb's mind at ease/rest

data.chText: 安慰；宽解；使宽心
data.enText: to do or say sth to make sb stop worrying about sth

data.chText: 放松
data.enText: relax

data.chText: 休息；放松
data.enText: to relax, sleep or do nothing after a period of activity or illness; to not use a part of your body for some time

data.chText: 医生叫我休息。
data.enText: The doctor told me to rest.

data.chText: 知道她安然无恙地回到家里，我就可以放心了。
data.enText: I can rest easy (= stop worrying) knowing that she's safely home.

data.chText: 他非得找到她才会安心。
data.enText: He won't rest (= will never be satisfied) until he finds her.

data.chText: 每过半小时让眼睛休息一下。
data.enText: Rest your eyes every half an hour.

data.chText: 支撑
data.enText: support

data.chText: （被）支撑；（使）倚靠；托
data.enText: to support sth by putting it on or against sth; to be supported in this way

data.chText: 他双手托着下巴。
data.enText: His chin rested on his hands.

data.chText: 他双手托着下巴。
data.enText: He rested his chin in his hands.

data.chText: 把头靠在我肩上。
data.enText: Rest your head on my shoulder.

data.chText: 他们的自行车靠在墙上。
data.enText: Their bikes were resting against the wall.

data.chText: 被搁置
data.enText: be left

data.chText: 被搁置；中止
data.enText: if you let a matter rest , you stop discussing it or dealing with it

data.chText: 事情不能就此了结——我想上告。
data.enText: The matter cannot rest there─I intend to sue.

data.chText: 被埋葬
data.enText: be buried

data.chText: （委婉说法，与be buried同义）安息，长眠
data.enText: to be buried. People say rest to avoid saying be buried .

data.chText: 在当地的墓地里，她长眠在她丈夫的墓旁。
data.enText: She rests beside her husband in the local cemetery.

data.chText: 愿他安息吧。
data.enText: May he rest in peace .
rest assured (that…)

data.chText: （强调所言确凿无误）尽管放心
data.enText: used to emphasize that what you say is true or will definitely happen

data.chText: 你就放心吧，我们会千方百计找到他。
data.enText: You may rest assured that we will do all we can to find him.
rest your case

data.chText: 我的论证到此为止（已经足够）
data.enText: used to say that you do not need to say any more about sth because you think that you have proved your point

data.chText: （律师在法庭上）对案情陈述完毕
data.enText: used by lawyers in court to say that they have finished presenting their case

data.chText: 控方对案情陈述完毕。
data.enText: The prosecution rests its case.
breathe/rest easy

data.chText: 安下心；松口气
data.enText: to relax and stop worrying

data.chText: 你尽管放心，我不会告诉任何人的。
data.enText: You can rest easy─I'm not going to tell anyone.
God rest his/her soul
God rest him/her

data.chText: 魂归天国；安息主怀
data.enText: used to show respect when you are talking about sb who is dead
rest/sit on your laurels

data.chText: 满足于既得成就；不思进取
data.enText: to feel so satisfied with what you have already achieved that you do not try to do any more
rest on/upon sb/sth

data.chText: 依靠；依赖
data.enText: to depend or rely on sb/sth

data.chText: 现在所有的希望都寄托在你的身上。
data.enText: All our hopes now rest on you.

data.chText: 凝视；凝望
data.enText: to look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她的目光落在我手里的一张纸上。
data.enText: Her eyes rested on the piece of paper in my hand.
rest on sth

data.chText: 基于；以…为基础
data.enText: to be based on sth

data.chText: 整个论证都是基于一个错误的假设。
data.enText: The whole argument rests on a false assumption.
rest with sb (to do sth)

data.chText: 是…的责任（或分内的事）
data.enText: if it rests with sb to do sth , it is their responsibility to do it

data.chText: 管理部门应当为他们的行动说出个道理来。
data.enText: It rests with management to justify their actions.

data.chText: 要由医生作出最后决定。
data.enText: The final decision rests with the doctors.

data.text: break ♦ rest ♦ breather ♦ breathing space ♦ respite ♦ time out

data.chText: 以上各词均表示短暂的休息。
data.enText: These are all words for a short period of time spent relaxing.
break

data.chText: 指间歇、休息：
data.enText: a short period of time when you stop what you are doing and rest or eat

data.chText: 咱们休息一会儿吧。
data.enText: Let's take a break .

data.chText: 在英国英语中，break指课间休息。北美英语表示此义用recess。
data.enText: In British English break is a period of time between lessons at school. The North American English word is recess .
rest

data.chText: 指休息时间、睡眠时间：
data.enText: a period of relaxing, sleeping or doing nothing after a period of activity

data.chText: 我们停下来作个应有的休息。
data.enText: We stopped for a well-earned rest.
breather

data.chText: 指活动进行中的短暂休息：
data.enText: ( informal ) a short pause in an activity to rest or relax

data.chText: 五分钟的休息
data.enText: a five-minute breather
breathing space

data.chText: 指脑力或体力活动期间的短暂休息、喘息时间：
data.enText: a short pause in the middle of a period of mental or physical effort

data.chText: 这一延误使该党有了喘息之机来厘定其政策。
data.enText: This delay gives the party a breathing space in which to sort out its policies.

data.chText: 用breather还是breathing space？
breather主动权在自己，breathing space须等待机会或主动争取；breather用于休息放松，breathing space用于理顺或整理事物。
data.enText: You decide when to take a breather ; a breathing space has to be given or won. A breather is for relaxing; a breathing space is for sorting things out.
breather or breathing space?
respite

data.chText: 指从困境或不愉快、不舒适的状态中得到的暂缓、暂停：
data.enText: a short break from sth difficult or unpleasant

data.chText: 药物暂时缓解了疼痛。
data.enText: The drug brought a brief respite from the pain.
time out

data.chText: 指暂停工作或学习的时间：
data.enText: ( informal , especially NAmE ) time for resting or relaxing away from your usual work or studies

data.chText: 去游泳池边歇一歇吧。
data.enText: Take time out to relax by the pool.

ex.chText: 他非常累，妻子建议他休息休息。
ex.enText: He was so tired that his wife suggested he should get some rest.

ex.chText: 两堂课之间有10分钟休息时间。
ex.enText: There is a 10-minute break between two classes.

ex.chText: 昨天他们连续工作了18个小时。
ex.enText: They worked for 18 hours without a break yesterday.

synonyms.bx: 指短暂的中止，如工作或活动之间的休息。

ex.chText: 幕间休息的时候我再回你电话。
ex.enText: I will call you back in the interval.

ex.chText: 第一幕结束之后将休息15分钟。
ex.enText: There will be a 15-minute interval after the first act.

synonyms.bx: 指戏剧或音乐会各场次之间的休息。

ex.chText: 议会的夏季休会期为多久？
ex.enText: How long is the Parliament's summer recess?

ex.chText: 他总是说他在学校最喜欢的是课间休息。
ex.enText: He always said that his favourite thing at school is recess.

synonyms.bx: 指议会不工作的时期，或学生的课间休息。

ex.chText: 她退休余下的时间都在养花中度过。
ex.enText: She spent the remainder of her retirement growing flowers.
When will the remainder be paid off?
Twenty-eight divided by nine gives you a remainder of 1.

synonyms.bx: 泛指从整体取走或用掉部分后的剩余部分，通常与定冠词 the 连用；也指除法运算中的余数。

ex.chText: 她把晚饭的剩菜扔掉了。
ex.enText: She threw away the remains of her supper.

ex.chText: 几处古罗马遗迹得到了很好的保护。
ex.enText: Several Roman remains have been well protected.

synonyms.bx: 指某物得以保留且未被破坏的部分。

ex.chText: 我们两人每人只能拿两个包，剩下的怎么办？
ex.enText: Each of us can only carry two bags. What about the rest?

ex.chText: 3名银行劫匪被捕，其余的逃走了。
ex.enText: Three of the bank robbers were arrested, and the rest escaped.

ex.chText: 你可以把剩下的西瓜带回宿舍。
ex.enText: You can bring the rest of this watermelon to your dormitory.

ex.chText: 他希望他能在一个安静的村庄里度过余生。
ex.enText: He wished that he could spend the rest of his life in a quiet village.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，通常与定冠词 the 连用。

d: 剩余部分；余下的人（或物）

ex.chText: 是什么造成了原油过剩？
ex.enText: What causes the surplus of crude oil?

ex.chText: 被剪掉的多余部分可以做什么用？
ex.enText: What can we do with the surplus trimmed away?

synonyms.bx: 指超出需求的过剩数量。

data.enText: and (all) the rest (of it)

data.chText: （列举时用）诸如此类，等等
data.enText: used at the end of a list to mean everything else that you might expect to be on the list

data.chText: 他想要大房子、豪华汽车，如此等等。
data.enText: He wants a big house and an expensive car and all the rest of it.
and the rest

data.chText: （比所说的）还要多；远不止此数
data.enText: used to say that the actual amount or number of sth is much higher than sb has stated

data.chText: “这要花250英镑…”“不止这些，不止这些！”
data.enText: ‘It cost 250 pounds…’ ‘And the rest, and the rest!’
at rest

data.chText: 静止；不动
data.enText: not moving

data.chText: 这种昆虫不动时看上去像一片枯叶。
data.enText: At rest the insect looks like a dead leaf.

data.chText: （委婉说法，与dead同义）安息，长眠
data.enText: dead and therefore free from trouble or anxiety. People say at rest to avoid saying dead .

data.chText: 她现在长眠在教堂墓地里。
data.enText: She now lies at rest in the churchyard.
come to rest

data.chText: 停止移动；不再移动
data.enText: to stop moving

data.chText: 汽车闯过护栏，在一块田里停了下来。
data.enText: The car crashed through the barrier and came to rest in a field.

data.chText: 他的目光停留在克拉拉的脸上。
data.enText: His eyes came to rest on Clara's face.
for the rest

data.chText: 除此之外；至于其他
data.enText: apart from that; as far as other matters are concerned

data.chText: 这本书中关于作者童年的一些章节倒还有意思。除此之外，便无聊至极。
data.enText: The book has some interesting passages about the author's childhood. For the rest, it is extremely dull.
give it a rest

data.chText: 不要再提（恼人的事）了
data.enText: used to tell sb to stop talking about sth because they are annoying you
give sth a rest

data.chText: 暂停；暂时不做
data.enText: to stop doing sth for a while
lay sb to rest

data.chText: （委婉说法，与bury同义）安葬
data.enText: to bury sb. People say to lay sb to rest to avoid saying to bury sb.

data.chText: 乔治被安葬在他父母墓旁。
data.enText: George was laid to rest beside his parents.
lay/put sth to rest

data.chText: （通过揭穿假象）平息，使停止
data.enText: to stop sth by showing it is not true

data.chText: 通告最终消除了一切有关他们的未来的推测。
data.enText: The announcement finally laid all the speculation about their future to rest.
the rest is history

data.chText: 结局是尽人皆知的；结果如何不必赘述
data.enText: used when you are telling a story to say that you do not need to tell the end of it, because everyone knows it already
put/set sb's mind at ease/rest

data.chText: 安慰；宽解；使宽心
data.enText: to do or say sth to make sb stop worrying about sth
(there's) no peace/rest for the wicked

data.chText: （有人抱怨工作太多时说）恶人决无平安
data.enText: used when sb is complaining that they have a lot of work to do
rest assured (that…)

data.chText: （强调所言确凿无误）尽管放心
data.enText: used to emphasize that what you say is true or will definitely happen

data.chText: 你就放心吧，我们会千方百计找到他。
data.enText: You may rest assured that we will do all we can to find him.
rest your case

data.chText: 我的论证到此为止（已经足够）
data.enText: used to say that you do not need to say any more about sth because you think that you have proved your point

data.chText: （律师在法庭上）对案情陈述完毕
data.enText: used by lawyers in court to say that they have finished presenting their case

data.chText: 控方对案情陈述完毕。
data.enText: The prosecution rests its case.
breathe/rest easy

data.chText: 安下心；松口气
data.enText: to relax and stop worrying

data.chText: 你尽管放心，我不会告诉任何人的。
data.enText: You can rest easy─I'm not going to tell anyone.
God rest his/her soul
God rest him/her

data.chText: 魂归天国；安息主怀
data.enText: used to show respect when you are talking about sb who is dead
rest/sit on your laurels

data.chText: 满足于既得成就；不思进取
data.enText: to feel so satisfied with what you have already achieved that you do not try to do any more
rest on/upon sb/sth

data.chText: 依靠；依赖
data.enText: to depend or rely on sb/sth

data.chText: 现在所有的希望都寄托在你的身上。
data.enText: All our hopes now rest on you.

data.chText: 凝视；凝望
data.enText: to look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她的目光落在我手里的一张纸上。
data.enText: Her eyes rested on the piece of paper in my hand.
rest on sth

data.chText: 基于；以…为基础
data.enText: to be based on sth

data.chText: 整个论证都是基于一个错误的假设。
data.enText: The whole argument rests on a false assumption.
rest with sb (to do sth)

data.chText: 是…的责任（或分内的事）
data.enText: if it rests with sb to do sth , it is their responsibility to do it

data.chText: 管理部门应当为他们的行动说出个道理来。
data.enText: It rests with management to justify their actions.

data.chText: 要由医生作出最后决定。
data.enText: The final decision rests with the doctors.

tr: freedom from activity (work or strain or responsibility)
example: took his repose by the swimming pool

tr: a support on which things can be put
example: the gun was steadied on a special rest

tr: a musical notation indicating a silence of a specified duration
something left after other parts have been taken away
example: there was no remainder
he threw away the rest
he took what he wanted and I got the balance

tr: euphemisms for death (based on an analogy between lying in a bed and in a tomb)
example: she was laid to rest beside her husband
they had to put their family pet to sleep
a body will continue in a state of rest until acted upon
people actually accomplish more when they take time for short rests
The dress remained wet after repeated attempts to dry it
rest assured
stay alone
He remained unmoved by her tears
The bad weather continued for another week

tr: take a short break from one's activities in order to relax

example: He rested his bad leg
Rest the dogs for a moment

tr: rest on or as if on a pillow
example: pillow your head
The birds perched high in the tree

tr: put something in a resting position, as for support or steadying
example: Rest your head on my shoulder
The committee is resting over the summer

tr: have a place in relation to something else
example: The fate of Bosnia lies in the hands of the West
The responsibility rests with the Allies

value.def: The rest is used to refer to all the parts of something or all the things in a group that remain or that you have not already mentioned.

example.ex: It was an experience I will treasure for the rest of my life...
example.tran: 我的余生都会珍惜这次经历。

example.ex: I'm going to throw a party, then invest the rest of the money...
example.tran: 我会开一个派对，然后把剩下的钱用来投资。

example.ex: He was unable to travel to Barcelona with the rest of the team.
example.tran: 他未能和其他队员一起去巴塞罗那。

example.ex: Only 55 per cent of the raw material is canned. The rest is thrown away.
example.tran: 只有55％的原材料被罐装储存。其余的都被扔掉了。

value.def: You can add and the rest or all the rest of it to the end of a statement or list when you want to refer in a vague way to other things that are associated with the ones you have already mentioned.

example.ex: ...a man with nice clothes, a Range Rover and the rest...
example.tran: 一个穿着体面、开着路虎如此等等的男人

example.ex: And what about racism and all the rest of it?
example.tran: 那种族主义之类的观念又怎么样呢？

value.tran: 诸如此类;如此等等;不一而足

value.boxu_tran: 谈论对象是不可数名词时，跟在rest后面的动词用单数：The rest of the food was delicious (其余的食物非常可口)。如果是谈论多个人或物，动词则用复数：The rest of the boys were delighted (其余的男孩都很高兴)。
value.boxu_usage: If you are talking about something that cannot be counted, the verb following rest is singular. The rest of the food was delicious. If you are talking about several people or things, the verb is plural. The rest of the boys were delighted.

value.def: If you rest or if you rest your body, you do not do anything active for a time.

example.ex: He's tired and exhausted, and has been advised to rest for two weeks...
example.tran: 他精疲力竭，被建议休息两周。

example.ex: Try to rest the injured limb as much as possible.
example.tran: 尽量不要活动受伤的手臂。

value.def: If you get some rest or have a rest, you do not do anything active for a time.

example.ex: 'You're worn out, Laura,' he said. 'Go home and get some rest.'...
example.tran: “你太累了，劳拉，”他说，“回家休息一下吧。”

example.ex: After I've had a good rest, I'll tell you everything.
example.tran: 我先好好歇一会儿，之后再告诉你一切。

value.def: If something such as a theory or someone's success rests on a particular thing, it depends on that thing.

example.ex: Such a view rests on a number of incorrect assumptions...
example.tran: 这样的观点建立在很多不正确的假设之上。

example.ex: The long-term future of the country rests on how we teach our children.
example.tran: 国家的长远未来取决于我们如何教育孩子。

value.def: If authority, a responsibility, or a decision rests with you, you have that authority or responsibility, or you are the one who will make that decision.

example.ex: The judge said that whether Miss Bergman wishes to admit it or not, the responsibility rests with her. ...
example.tran: 法官说不管伯格曼小姐愿不愿意承认，这件事的责任都在她。

example.ex: The final decision rested with the President.
example.tran: 最后的决定权在于总统。

value.def: If you rest something somewhere, you put it there so that its weight is supported.

example.ex: He rested his arms on the back of the chair...
example.tran: 他把手臂放在椅背上。

example.ex: He rested one of his crutches against the rail.
example.tran: 他把一根拐杖靠在栏杆上。

value.def: If something is resting somewhere, or if you are resting it there, it is in a position where its weight is supported.

example.ex: His head was resting on her shoulder...
example.tran: 他的头靠在她的肩上。

example.ex: He had been resting his head in his hands, deep in thought.
example.tran: 他双手撑着头，陷入了沉思。

value.def: If you rest on or against someone or something, you lean on them so that they support the weight of your body.

example.ex: He rested on his pickaxe for a while.
example.tran: 他在尖嘴镐上靠了一会儿。

value.def: A rest is an object that is used to support something, especially your head, arms, or feet.

example.ex: When you are sitting, keep your elbow on the arm rest.
example.tran: 坐立时，把胳膊肘靠在扶手上。

value.tran: （尤指头或四肢的）支撑物;撑架;托架

value.def: If your eyes rest on a particular person or object, you look directly at them, rather than somewhere else.

example.ex: As she spoke, her eyes rested on her husband's face.
example.tran: 她说话的时候，眼睛凝视着丈夫的脸。

value.def: When an object that has been moving comes to rest, it finally stops.

example.ex: The plane had plowed a path through a patch of forest before coming to rest in a field.
example.tran: 飞机猛冲过一片森林，在一片田野中停了下来。

value.def: If you say that someone can rest easy, you mean that they don't need to worry about a particular situation.

example.ex: How can any woman rest easy now, knowing her breast cancer may be misdiagnosed?
example.tran: 知道自己的乳腺癌可能被误诊，哪个女人能不担心呢？

value.def: If someone tells you to give something a rest, they want you to stop doing it because it annoys them or because they think it is harming you.

example.ex: Give it a rest, will you? We're trying to get some sleep...
example.tran: 你安静一下，好吗？我们想睡一会儿。

example.ex: I think you ought to give football a rest for a time.
example.tran: 我认为你应该暂时停止踢足球。

value.def: If you say that someone who has died is laid to rest, you mean that they are buried.

example.ex: His dying wish was to be laid to rest at the church near his Somerset home.
example.tran: 他的遗愿是把他安葬在家乡萨默塞特郡附近的教堂里。

value.def: If you lay something such as fears or rumours to rest or if you put them to rest, you succeed in proving that they are not true.

example.ex: His speech should lay those fears to rest...
example.tran: 他的演说应当会消除那些忧虑。

example.ex: I am determined to put to rest these rumours that we are in financial trouble.
example.tran: 我决定平息那些说我们正面临财政困难的谣言。

value.def: If someone refuses to let a subject rest, they refuse to stop talking about it, especially after they have been talking about it for a long time.

example.ex: I am not prepared to let this matter rest...
example.tran: 我不准备就此罢休。

example.ex: Let it rest, Rachel. Leave her in peace.
example.tran: 别说了，雷切尔。让她平静一下。

value.tran: (尤指长时间的谈论后）停止讨论(某个话题)

value.def: To put someone's mind at rest or set their mind at rest means to tell them something that stops them worrying.

example.ex: She was quick to put his mind at rest. 'Mrs Barrett will be delighted to have your brothers back,' she said...
example.tran: 她很快就让他放心了。“巴雷特太太会很高兴让你的兄弟们回来的，”她说道。

example.ex: A brain scan last Friday finally set his mind at rest.
example.tran: 上周五的脑部扫描终于让他放心了。

trans: 至于其他；至于其余,至于其他
(目光等)停留在…上；被支持在…上
卧床休息；臥床休息；卧床；床休息
安息日；休息日；休假；一天休息日
厕所；（公共建筑物内的）公用厕所；洗手间；休息室
